Model.NeuralNetwork.Layers

Class Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.NeuralNetwork.Layers.Layer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HiddenLayer, InputLayer, OutputLayer

    public abstract class Layer
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes Layer in the Neural network
    Author:
    Nicolas Dutly

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Jama.Matrix delta
      Describes the Matrix containing the delta for each neuron (used in back-propagation)
      protected int nbOfNeurons
      Describes the number of neurons in the Layer.
      protected Neuron[] neurons
      Describes an array of neurons, containing the neurons in the output layer
      (package private) Layer nextLayer
      Describes the next Layer after this one (if any)
      (package private) Layer prevLayer
      Describes the previous layer of type HiddenLayer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Layer(int nbOfNeurons) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void adjustLayerWeights()
      Adjusts the weights of the individual synapses using the delta calculated in
      abstract void calculate_delta()
      Calculates the delta using the back-propagation algorithm (Using stochastic gradient descent).
      protected void generateNeurons()
      Generates the neurons in the layer, with a bias neuron.
      Jama.Matrix getDelta() 
      int getNbOfNeurons() 
      Neuron[] getNeurons() 
      void process()
      Activates each neuron in Layer (except the bias)
      void setNextLayer(Layer nextLayer) 
      void setPrevLayer(Layer prevLayer)
      When the previous layer is specified, the layer has enough information to generate its neurons, which take place in the function, by calling generateNeurons() setPrevLayer(Layer prevLayer) is not called in the input layer, as such the input layer's neuron generation takes place in it

    • Field Detail

      • neurons

        protected Neuron[] neurons
        Describes an array of neurons, containing the neurons in the output layer

      • nbOfNeurons

        protected int nbOfNeurons
        Describes the number of neurons in the Layer.

        Describes the Matrix containing the delta for each neuron (used in back-propagation)

        Describes the previous layer of type HiddenLayer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Layer

        public Layer(int nbOfNeurons)
        Parameters:
        nbOfNeurons - number of neurons in the layer

    • Method Detail

      • generateNeurons

        protected void generateNeurons()
        Generates the neurons in the layer, with a bias neuron. This method is overridden by the output layer, as it contains no bias
        See Also:
        BiasNeuron

      • calculate_delta

        public abstract void calculate_delta()
        Calculates the delta using the back-propagation algorithm (Using stochastic gradient descent). The calculation is different on hidden layers and output layers, as such this method has to be implemented by the corresponding layer.

      • adjustLayerWeights

        public void adjustLayerWeights()
        Adjusts the weights of the individual synapses using the delta calculated in
        See Also:
        calculate_delta()

      • process

        public void process()
        Activates each neuron in Layer (except the bias)

      • getNbOfNeurons

        public int getNbOfNeurons()
        Returns:
        layer's number of neurons

      • getDelta

        public Jama.Matrix getDelta()
        Returns:
        the layer's delta Matrix

      • getNeurons

        public Neuron[] getNeurons()
        Returns:
        the layers neuron array

      • setPrevLayer

        public void setPrevLayer(Layer prevLayer)
        When the previous layer is specified, the layer has enough information to generate its neurons, which take place in the function, by calling generateNeurons() setPrevLayer(Layer prevLayer) is not called in the input layer, as such the input layer's neuron generation takes place in it
        Parameters:
        prevLayer - The previous Layer

      • setNextLayer

        public void setNextLayer(Layer nextLayer)
        Parameters:
        nextLayer - The next Layer
